title: Manchester United transfer news LIVE deadline day updates and Marcel Sabitzer to Man United latest
body_text:
Manchester United completed the signing of Marcel Sabitzer on loan from Bayern Munich on deadline day.
Sabitzer, 28, has joined United on a loan until the end of the season and there is no option to make the deal permanent.
United were rocked by the news that Christian Eriksen faces several months out of action with an ankle injury on Tuesday and it is feared that he could be sidelined until early-May, which promoted the club to assess their options.
United are light on options in midfield, especially with Donny van de Beek already out for the rest of the season, which led to talks with Bayern Munich to sign midfielder Sabitzer, who was identified as a short-term option, on loan
There were also multiple loan outgoings from the club on deadline day, including an exit for Axel Tuanzebe to Stoke City.
Recap deadline day as it happened right here.
Key Events
Thank you
That was busier than expected, wasn't it? You can go to sleep now, Reds.
Thanks for following our coverage on deadline day.
Tuanzebe joins Stoke City on loan
United defender Axel Tuanzebe has joined Stoke City on loan until the end of the season.
Tuanzebe, 25, only returned to first-team training this month after a lengthy spell on the sidelines with injury and he has completed a move to Championship club Stoke late on deadline day in search of regular minutes.
Sources have indicated the club considers the move a good opportunity for the player after returning from his lay-off.
How United pulled off the signing of Sabitzer in 12 hours
United only contacted Bayern Munich on deadline day to complete the signing of Marcel Sabitzer.
United confirmed the arrival of Sabitzer from Bayern Munich on loan for the remainder of the season at 12.10am, having filed a deal sheet before the 11pm deadline on Tuesday evening.
The club do not have an obligation or option to buy the 28-year-old, who is under contract at Bayern until 2025.
United complete Sabitzer loan transfer
United have confirmed the signing of Marcel Sabitzer on loan from Bayern Munich until June 2023.
Sabitzer, 28, has joined United on a loan until the end of the season and there is no option to make the deal permanent.
The Austrian midfielder has made 443 career club appearances across Europe, including 54 since joining Bayern Munich in August 2021, and he was previously club captain of RB Leipzig.
We're waiting for the announcement
The Sabitzer deal is set to go through, but we're still waiting for the official announcement.
Everyone wants to see him in that shirt...
United's full list of ins and outs after January window
United's business in the 2023 January transfer window is now complete.
Although it was expected to be a relatively quiet deadline day, the news that Christian Eriksen could be sidelined with an ankle injury until May forced the club into assessing their options, which led to United pursuing a loan move for Marcel Sabitzer.
At the time of writing, the signing of Sabitzer has not been confirmed, but the deal is set to be finalised in time.
TRANSFER WINDOW CLOSES
The January transfer window has closed. Jack Butland and Wout Weghorst have both joined the club on loan this month, with the details of Marcel Sabitzer's arrival now being finalised.
United discover their potential Carabao Cup final opponents
United now know that they will be facing Newcastle United in the final of the Carabao Cup, should they get past Nottingham Forest on Wednesday evening, after they beat Southampton 3-1 on aggregate.
Newcastle held a one-goal lead heading into the second leg of their semi-final at St James' Park thanks to Joelinton's effort last week. Inside five minutes that advantage was doubled when Sean Longstaff slotted a right-footed effort underneath the dive of Gavin Bazunu.
Longstaff added his second 15 minutes later when he converted Miguel Almiron's cross to send the Newcastle fans into raptures. Less than 10 minutes later, Che Adams capitalised on a sloppy Magpies pass to give the Saints a glimmer of hope.
What time is the deadline tonight?
The January transfer window shuts at 11pm tonight, which means United have just over an hour to complete the signing of Sabizter, who arrived at Carrington at around 8.30pm.
Sabitzer arrives at Carrington on deadline day
Marcel Sabitzer has arrived at Carrington for his United medical ahead of his loan switch from Bayern Munich.
Sabitzer, 28, left Germany for Manchester at around 6pm and he's made a swift journey to Carrington, where he will complete his loan move from Bayern.
The midfielder is set to join United on loan until the end of the season and the deal must be completed by the 11pm deadline.
United 'rejected chance' to sign Saul
According to Sky Sports, before settling on Sabitzer, United rejected the chance to sign four midfielders.
Saul Niguez was one option that was turned down as well as Houssem Aouar, Yannick Carrasco and Isco.
The Bayern Munich midfielder is currently at Carrington as the Reds aim to finalise his move.
WATCH: Sabitzer arrives at Carrington
Reminder that the transfer window closes tonight at 11pm...
Man City's Luke Mbete makes Shoretire admission
Following his move to Bolton Wanderers on loan this afternoon, Manchester City defender Mbete explained that he was looking forward to playing alongside the United youngster.
Shola is someone I have known for a while now. We played against each other from young ages and we have been with each other at England, so we have got a good connection. It is always nice to see familiar faces. With the team we have got, I feel like they have welcomed me really well and I am excited to play with them and to push forward.
Everything Ten Hag said in deadline day press conference
Erik ten Hag spoke to the press on Tuesday afternoon as he looked ahead to United's Carabao Cup semi-final second leg against Nottingham Forest.
Ten Hag was quizzed on United's deadline day transfer plans, with time running out for the club to buy or sell any players in the January window.
United youngsters to join Altrincham in innovative loan moves
United youngsters Joe Hugill and Sonny Aljofree are set to join National League side Altrincham in innovative loan moves.
It is understood the FA Youth Cup winners will continue to train with United and be available to play for the Under-21s as well as Altrincham.
Sources say the legislation allows them to gain non-league experience whilst remaining involved in the day-to-day environment at United. Hugill and Aljofree's academy teammate Maxi Oyedele joined Altrincham on loan earlier this month.
When Sabitzer played at Old Trafford
The midfielder played at Old Trafford on October 28, 2020 in the Champions League.
Sabitzer flying to England to complete transfer
Bayern Munich midfielder Marcel Sabitzer is flying to Manchester to complete his loan move to United.
The Manchester Evening News understands United already have vehicles at Manchester Airport to ferry Sabitzer to their Carrington training complex.
By the time Sabitzer touches down, United are expected to have the best part of four hours to complete the deal before tonight's 11pm deadline.
United backed to sign Amrabat
It would be a shock, but the bookies have given odds of 9/1 for United to sign Sofyan Amrabat.
- Barcelona 6/4
- Atletico Madrid 5/1
- Man Utd 9/1
- Liverpool 10/1
- Arsenal 11/1
- Newcastle 12/1
Odds via Betfair.
United stance on Wellens' future
United youngster Charlie Wellens is set to leave the club at the end of the season.
Wellens, 20, has been pictured on trial with Barnsley's Under-21s and the Manchester Evening News understands that he is currently looking at clubs ahead of an expected departure in the summer when his United contract is due to expire.
Sources have also indicated there is no loan exit on the cards for Wellens ahead of the January transfer window deadline.
'His development couldn't have been better'
Ralf Rangnick's comments on Sabitzer from March 2020 make for an interesting read.
"His development couldn't have been any better," Rangnick said in an interview with Kicker and continued: "He has never liked to lose, which I absolutely believe is a positive thing. But he used to get a little too fired up.
"He has clearly changed for the better and has become a leader. The way he has developed his personality is remarkable. I've only rarely experienced something similar."
